Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, in a great location, for a city visit.”
Reviews.Author: Lesley B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here alone as I was visiting my son, who shares a flat just off La Rambla. I felt very safe and comfortable. The room was quite small but had a double bed an excellent en suite. I would have liked tea making facilities and air conditioning, but the lack of these did not spoil my stay. I didn't eat in the hotel as there are so many local bars, restaurants and food stores very near. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, small and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Andy X
Reviews.Content: This is well situated for the centre of Barcelona and provided a great location to meet family who live there. The room was small but clean and the breakfast was good. There was a thunderstorm one night which even closed windows didn't mask but that's hardly the hotel's fault. I would return, even though bed was a bit hard!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Medium Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kdr1968
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by a business colleague who also made the reservation for us. We got a great rate and were lucky enough to get 1st floor rooms which came with a balcony and a hospitality tray including fresh cut fruit. The rooms were very clean and comfortable with plenty of light. The hotel breakfast was very good and there was plenty of choice that you would expect with a typical Spanish Hotel. The hotel is located in an excellent location to explore the main sites of the central Barcelona. There are also an abundance of great little restaurants in the vicinity to give you more choice for Dinner. The hotel are very obliging and will make onward reservations for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: Lee P
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in March, 2012 on vacation with my girlfriend. Nice lobby and staff waiting outside to help us in with our bags once we arrived early Sunday morning. Front desk staff did not speak that much English, but you are in Spain so what do you expect? Girlfriend spoke spanish, so it wasn't a problem anyways. Front desk staff gave good directions on how to get around rather it be walking or by the metro. Rooms and bathroom were very nice, exceeded mine and my girlfriends expectations. There was no AC in the room, but we just left the window open while we were out during the day and the room was fine to sleep in at night as the weather was wonderful. The hotel is located in a great, safe part of town, close to La Rambla, or a main metro station (three blocks away) which can then take you anywhere with in two to three stops. The night before we left for an early flight out to Rome, we requested a cab be ready at 5am and a wake up call at 4:45 am. Both were right on time, with the cab outside waiting for us. My only complaint was the restaurant in the lobby, had the fixed menu dinner for 18 Euros, not good at all, but plenty of restaurants near by that are great! Also the beds were a little too firm for our liking, but every person likes a different mattress, still slept just fine. Would reccommend to stay here to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Rather Mediocre on All Levels”
Reviews.Author: LD5500
Reviews.Content: We paid an average price for this hotel when we stayed for 2 nights in May 2011, and I guess we got what we paid for: a hotel that was average on all levels. It had a pleasant lobby but an understaffed front desk. The front desk employees weren't particularly knowledgeable about local attractions, tours, or discounts. Our room was basic and fairly small, but acceptable. Beds were less than comfortable, feeling more like a roll-away or sofa bed mattress. Las Ramblas was within walking distance, but expect a bit of exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Misrepresentation”
Reviews.Author: emonya
Reviews.Content: This hotel claims 4 stars. There was no air conditioning because the air was turned off. We were told to open our window. It was very noisy and we were not able to sleep. The hotel coffee shop was our of coffee at 10:30 am! There are two guest elevators one of which was out of service for over 12 hours. We wanted to sit outside in the court yard one morning but the court yard was filled with noisy school kid who appeared to be spending their recess time in this court yard. Lastly, when we were ready to leave, it took about 10 minutes befor I could find someone to call a taxi for us. Should I say more about the alleged number of stars?

Reviews.Title: “Small and lovely but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Ellross
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights pre-cruise in November. The hotel is in a lovely area away from the noise of Las Ramblas but convenient to the metro. The staff is very nice and the lobby has a comfortable feel. We had 2 rooms on the 4th floor in the back. Since we arrived early in the morning we wanted to get some sleep before we started our time in Barcelona. However they had already turned off the AC for the winter, and it was too warm in the room to leave the windows closed. When we opened the window we were bombarded with noise. There is a small park in the courtyard behind the hotel. We had to do earplugs to get any sleep. Also if you don't like a hard mattress you might be disapointed in the bed. Also the rooms are very very small. While the bathroom is adequate is isn't layed out very well. When you sit on the toilet your knees hit the vanity. We had gotten the hotel on Priceline as a 4 star property. While I think in general it does deserve the rating in many of the categories, the room just brought it down for us. Again the area the hotel is in is really lovely. We walked to many smaller restaurants and bakeries and just enjoyed the architecture. We were happy to not be in the Las Ramblas area with even more noise. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but too hot in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Von_Smiles
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect in the nicer part of Barcelona. However, the room was so hot I had to sleep with the window open (and it was quite noisy outside). Tried the air conditioning but it was blowing out hot air (it was actually warm and sunny during the day so heated up the room). Bed was very comfortable and The room was spacious. Poor selection of TV channels though.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Swanlake1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent but a little far out from the rambella. The staff were excellent and very helpfull. Metro station was only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Cost affordable hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: travellingpinoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this particular hotel for four days (Oct 30 - Nov 2, 2011) for a weekend getaway and to visit my sister who just lives across town. Checked in an hour early and no problem, found the room very clean, and it was at the back of the hotel that you can see a children's playground for locals. The toilet is also very clean, they clean the room and toilet everyday and they also replenish the free complimentary toiletries that you use, first time I've seen a hotel provide for a shaving razor (upon request, of course). There are lots of restaurants nearby and also there is a grocery store across the hotel which was really handy for us to buy some bottled water and snacks. The hotel is near two metro lines, Provenca which is two blocks and Diagonal which is three. If you like the branded stuff, you can find them along Passeig de Gracia which is also near the hotel. The only thing bad about it was the air-conditioning unit wasn't working when we were there. but, we can open the window and enjoy the evening breeze. Can't wait to go back and we'll definitely use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “If you leave something unattended, it WILL be stolen at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tinyfist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Evenia Rossello in October of 2011, and I will never be staying at this hotel again. The rooms and food are adequate, but the service is terrible. Our room doorlock/cardreader kept breaking down, and nobody would fix it for us. The elevator broke. But the worst, and ultimately unforgivable transgression was when my girlfriend left her wallet behind after breakfast one morning in the empty restaurant. In the time it took us to go upstairs to our room and come back down, the staff had already moved it from our table to the office behind the front desk, and yet all the large denomination bills were missing. The thief had left all the ID cards and small bills behind, as to avoid us being required to report the theft to authorities. I asked the front desk how it could have been stolen in such a short amount of time (in THEIR OFFICE, no less) and his reply was a shrug and, "it's like leaving it on the street." So, we wrote it off as our fault for leaving it behind (which it was), but we'd hoped that common decency would have been applicable here. So while I can't tell you if this would happen at another hotel, I can guarantee if you leave your property unattended at the Evenia Rosello, it WILL be stolen. Might as well take your chances at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location, beds so comfortable, best nights sleep for ages!”
Reviews.Author: welshbabe6666
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in October 2011. Arrived Saturday afternoon, check in was a breeze, paid £50 for the safe key. stayed in room 601, which looked out over the back of the building over the childrens park. The room was big and very quiet. The bed was so comfortable and the window could be opened which was great as the aircon was very noisy. The room was cleaned every day and was very clean, toiletries were replenished. Had breakfast across the street in Bodega Joan, one word of warning though, once they figure out you are a tourist the price is never the same twice. The walk to the metro was a block and half away to Provenca and takes about three minutes. Went everywhere on the metro, down to the beach, the port and generally very easy to use. get the ten trip card. Weather was great in October, 23c every day. I loved the Eixample area, very upmarket and loads of reasonable places to eat. supermarket opposite the hotel very useful for snacks and fruit is better than in the market. Found all the spanish people lovely. first day was the big protest march, so many people turned up for that, fascinating to see the support, thousands and thousands of protesters. Cant wait to go back and would definately use the hotel again. we booked the advance price which was excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Would have wanted to give 5 stars but..”
Reviews.Author: sally_forth15
Reviews.Content: I would have wanted to give this hotel 5 stars (we got to stay here thanks to the offer of "stay 2 nights and get the 3rd night free") because the rooms are really nice, comfy and spacious, have very good showers in the lovely bathrooms BUT the air conditioning in my room unfortunately was slow to cool (the other room was okay) and there was no free wifi. Location wise, it's a 7-minute walk to Diagonal and a few stops away from Sants-Estacio. There are eateries and fruits grocers nearby. One restaurant (Bodega Joan) right in front of the hotel is worth going to because of the convenience and good food. Would I stay here again? Yeah, if I stumbled upon the fantastic offer again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: SashaDean
Reviews.Content: Everything in the rooms was updated and clean. The bathroom was nice and it was nice to be able to open our hotel room window and look out onto busy city streets with cafes and shops below. It's a little far from the center of downtown Barcelona and the beach, but it's conveniently located near two different metro stations. Our stay here was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: AaronB101
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here, its in a nice peaceful area surrounded by lovely cafe's and restaurants. The staff were always very friendly and helpful, hotel was in great condition and comfortable and clean. The rooms were as you see in the pictures, maybe a little small but perfectly adequate. I will definitley stay here again when I next come to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Lee B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, rooms as on photo, really clean and excellent location. 2 blocks away from the metro and also has a supermarket right across the street!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Slainte2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the family rooms at the Evenia Rosello in June 2011. The room was spacious, air conditioned and spotlessly clean and equipped with amenities that you don't usually find in European hotels. The hotel also features a small restaurant that opens out on to a patio at the back, and the prices are quite reasonable. There is a grocery store located directly across from the hotel that has a decent selection of wines, cheese and fresh-baked goods. This came in really handy as it allowed us to pack a picnic and enjoy lunch on the go, without worrying about finding a restaurant that would meet the requirements of the picky eater in the family. Probably the best feature of this hotel is its location. You are close to everything, but far enough away that you can get a good night's sleep after a busy day of seeing the sights. It is a five minute walk from the Diagonal subway station, one of the major lines that bisects the city. It is also about a ten minute walk to the Passeig de Gracia, where you'll find amazing shops and restaurants, as well as some of the famous Gaudi architecture. One other little gem you will find on the street is the Bodega Joan. It is a little local bar across from the hotel. It looks like nothing special, but the food is so good and unbelieveably inexpensive. It's been around since the 1940s, so they must be doing something right. Have to give this little place a mention because you'd probably bypass it in favour of something more upscale otherwise. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Evenia Rosello. It's the perfect hotel for families - clean, comfortable and conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly,great location,clean.”
Reviews.Author: cagandpag
Reviews.Content: Our stay was pre and post cruise. Everything was excellent except for the mattress being extra extra firm. The staff was friendly and helpful. The central location was close to shopping, dining and sightseeing on foot. The only thing that could keep me from a top rating was the very hard bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Eliaza
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Evenia Rosellofor 5 nights. This hotel is ideally located to walk to the Catalunya Place, eat on Catalunya Rambla, see Gaudi buildings and shop, all in walking distance. We also walked to the beach but the hotel is also close to the subway if you think it is a bit far. The area is quiet and, as two girls, we felt safe all the time The hotel is very clean, the room is a bit small and the bed a bit hard, but for me, a nice bathroom is very important and it was great: large enough, clean, equipped, with a large number of soft towels. Service is excellent and all the staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good and you can sit outside to eat, which we loved. I would definitely stay there again. The only thing I would have liked is to have free WI-FI in our room - it was 9E a day but you can use one of their 2 computers on the main hall at no cost.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rask46
Reviews.Content: I went on a combined business/leisure 3 day trip. I have stayed several times in Barcelona, but this was the first time at Evenia Rosello, and it was a pleasant surprice. Location is quiet and still quite close to the center. Staff is very friendly, breakfast is good and rooms are good, clean and silent. What more do you need? ;-) All in all, very good value for money and a hotel to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would give it 3.5 stars if I could”
Reviews.Author: vanbc2009
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of European hotels that call themselves four stars, this one is just a bit lower than that. Professional staff but like so many in Barcelona they seem to either resent their jobs or the tourists they're dealing with all day. You get what you need from them but usually with a sigh. Most parts of the hotel have had a recent update and the rooms are the standard two twin beds pushed together. The walk to La Rambla and Old Barcelona are a bit longer than we thought but it's Barcelona so it's still a nice walk. It's a good 15-20 minutes to Catalunya Plaza. 45 minutes if you want to get to the beach (which isn't worth it; take the 30 minute train to Sitges - much better).

Reviews.Title: “Great quieter location, nice boutique hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: xichic
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent 4 nights here during our European vacation and we found the hotel to be convenient and comfortable. The room itself was a decent size considering how small most hotels in Europe are. The bathroom was well appointed to and was spacious and clean. The bed was a bit stiff, but nothing too terrible. We were also here during the Barca vs Manchester game and though there were a lot of celebrating going on outside, we could not hear it in the room. The location is great if you are looking for something that is close to the best shopping strip in Barcelona, BUT at a better price. We did not try the restaurant as it was pricey, but there are so many places to go around this hotel that it was not a problem to find great food and stores around. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a nice pleasant stay in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jotravy
Reviews.Content: Is very nice. We like to be closer to the rambla as we like to walk everywhere. Was a bit far, but not bad. Once comfy with metro system it was easy. Very clean modern hotel. Got good deal through hot-wire not first choice as lacks European charm of older hotels, but would stay again if price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Only smiles at the Rosello”
Reviews.Author: oddeseys
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through priceline and got it for $120 a night. On arriving at the airport we took the airport bus and got off at Universitat. It is a very long walk up to the hotel from there, but definately doable if you are not overloaded. The hotel is an easy walk from Passeig de Gracia and is within 2 blocks of the metro. It is in a nice and quiet area which is a relief if you have been spending the day near the Ramblas area. Every employee at this hotel was gracious and helpful. We asked multiple times a day for directions and advice and were given complete attention each time. The front desk staff were always smiling and polite- you could tell that they took pride in their work. You really can't go wrong here

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience - well worth it"”
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn_Inkblot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in August 2010. Clean, modern rooms (a bit small but adequate), very friendly and helpful staff, good location. The breakfast buffet was enjoyable and there is a really nice restaurant right next door (and supermarket across the street). Metros are a few blocks away and you can walk to Las Ramblas and most of the historic sites in Barcelona. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kidlid21
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a very modern hotel with well appointed, spacious modern rooms. The beds are comfortable, the a/c was more than adequate. The location was ideal, far enough from the main tourist streets that noise wasn't terrible, but within a couple of metro stops (or a 10-15min walk) of Las Ramblas and other nearby sites. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. Only complaint, no iron available. Had to pay for pressing service which we weren't interested in doing. I can't comment too much about noise since I am a very light sleeper and used ear plugs. While awake, the hotel seemed relatively quiet. Of note, the hotel is rated a 4 star but was more like a 3.5 star hotel. For the price we paid (through a priceline bid), this was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff,”
Reviews.Author: SteHallsworth
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here and found the hotel great. Nice bright and spacious room, which was very clean. Checkout was 12 midday which is great if you're lazy. Didn't have cause to speak to the staff other than on check-in, but they were English speaking and helpful. A stocked mini-bar was in the room. Obviously you pay for the convenience, but handy if you want to use it. The air con was acceptable, although not as cold as I personally like. Would have liked free wi-fi internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JCCTraveller
Reviews.Content: This a a very nice hotel in a good location. You can walk to the metro station in 5 min. and will find a lot of shops around (including 2 food stores). There are a few bars around and at weekends people will be out in the streets enjoying their drinks. We stayed on the 4th floor so had some noise but with the windows closed it was OK (this was on a Saturday night, on Sunday it was quieter). Would stay again at this hotel: good price (check out their website for deals), nice and clean and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: liorv3
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast , good rooms (a little bit small) , nice staff , a very good value for the money . In the center of Barcelona , close to all the tourist places .

Reviews.Title: “Great central spot. Good food, good value.”
Reviews.Author: miraclemum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room before a cruise. Our room was quite near the lift, but we heard no noise. Neither did we hear noise from the aftermath of the Barcelona-Madrid football match. The room was spotless and large. Plenty of room, even though there were three of us. Toiletries supplied included disposable toothbrushes and toothpaste. The beds were comfortable, but on the firm side, something to be aware of if you prefer soft beds. Downstairs was a lovely restaurant, with tables outside in a little square. We had a great value three course lunch (menu of the day) for €12. The quality of the food was superb and for us, innovative. We walked to the Rambla and had a lovely time window shopping. In the evening we walked less than five minutes to the Igueldo Restaurant in the same street - a fantastic gastronomic experience.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Belfastraymond28
Reviews.Content: Hotel Evenia was excellent and all staff were very corteous and helpful. Information at reception was gladly given and printed my flight boarding passes without complaint. Breakfast food was excellent. Hotel is a little away from Paseig de Gracia. I was not familiar with metro and did not manage to use Diagonal station near hotel. I hope to do better next time in Metro. Local supermarket and bars nearby are good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, clean, great staff but noisy”
Reviews.Author: manctravellerx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights and was happy with the hotel and service. The room was modern and spacious, as was the bathroom. Bathroom has a hairdryer and also you are provided with some lovely shampoos and body milks as well as travel toothbrushes and some other bits and pieces. The shower water was always warm and was pretty powerful. Deposit of 50 euros was required to use the safe and after reading an earlier review on here was a bit worried about using it but made a note of how much money was in there each day and nothing went missing at any point. Room was cleaned and towels changed everyday and the staff in the hotel were all very helpful nd polite. Only downside really was that you could hear everything from our room. The doors in other rooms seemed to only slam and could hear people coughing next door. In the morning could hear constant noise from around 8am, doors slamming, people shouting to each other in the hallway, vacuuming and the vacuuming seemed to involve banging the vacuum into the walls and doors. This was the only downside of the hotel for me. Location was fantastic only a few minutes walk from Diaganol station which was about two stops from the Ramblas and also various other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: brownsugar97
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Evenia Rossello for 3 nights. Arrived around 3pm, very well situated, few meter from tube station,Passeig de gracia Avenue and La Rambla. Hotel from the exterior looks good condition, entrance to the reception is quite small with a dining area behind, small though but very clean and tidy. Good customer service from the front desk staff. Was however suprised about the quality of the room....very blend no WOW FACTOR......does not look like a 4* hotel (more like 3*) but still very clean and big(room 401), bathroom has suprised me..shower curtain (cheap quality one) . Hotel needs definitely some great refurbishement and new decoration to compete the 4* like the Gallery Hotel in same street where I stayed before. I would recommend this hotel for a few days, definitely not for a week !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Tranen
Reviews.Content: Location is quite good, some walking has to be done to come to the tourist traps, however we liked the location, cause we enjoyed the cafe cross the street, and the weather was pleasant for walking. Michael, the guy checking us in was by far the most service minded hotel staff Ive ever met, big kudos to him. Only drawback to this hotel was the extremly hard beds, made it tough to get a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more!”
Reviews.Author: Caitlistowel Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this hotel. The location, service and value was exceptional. I would really recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Maireadnewlands
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends in this hotel for 4 nights on my first visit to Barcelona. Room was small but very clean and contained everything required for a short break, it is in a quiet area and sleep was peaceful. The walk to Las Ramblas and Plaza Catalunga takes 15 minutes approx, (taxi 5 euro) with lovely shops and restaurants on route, I would particularly recommend having breakfast in Pauls, which you wll pass on the way, fabulous pastries and where all the locals eat which is a good sign! We did not eat or have a drink in the hotel so cannot comment on this area, but for location and value for money, I would have no hesitation on recommending the Evenia Rossello. It will be where I stay the next time I visit this city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: ajan34
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days with friends. The hotel I thougt was verry good consindering the price we for the whole trip. The rooms were nice and clean, most of the staff was friendly and the location was exelent.Its not a four star hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Business Class with Summer Discounts”
Reviews.Author: MurphyChickOTR
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a book ahead special summer rate and enjoyed a business class hotel for 107E a night for 3 people. The bathroom was extra large with extra nice amenities and a hairdryer. It was conveniently located near the metro in a nice neighborhood. On the negative side, the wireless high speed internet was way overpriced and somewhat slow for the money. Staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location, not the best service, bad air condition”
Reviews.Author: Irismtv
Reviews.Content: I've got a great deal from lastminute.com, so paid for two nights and the third one was free, otherwise I'd be less satisfied, because I stayed there in July, which is super hot, and the air conditions in the rooms are not really cooling the rooms. When I've asked to move to another room they weren't that nice, and after arguing with them and getting a key to another room, I realised all the AC are the same! When I checked out the receptionist refused to print the boarding pass for me, while giving me the excuse 'the computer is sending emails at the moment'. So, don't expect getting the extra mile from the desk.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff is dishonest! Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneOng
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked really nice when we checked in late on Thursday evening. Everything was clean, although the beds were slightly uncomfortable. However appearances are deceiving, as we found out the next day. We made a rookie mistake of keeping money in a locked up suitcase in the hotel to keep it safe from the infamous pickpockets of the city, only to have it stolen from the dishonest staff of our supposedly four-star-hotel. While we can't be 100 percent sure that it was the staff who did it, the nochalent attitude of the receptionist was disappointing. He was very quick to imply it was our own fault for not locking our doors properly, while the doors practically close themselves when we leave the hotel room. We only noticed that someone had meddled with our suitcase after I could not open it. After much difficulty in opening the suitcase, we noticed that everything (camera, passports, credit cards etc) was still in place except for the money. We went down to the receptionist to report this and all he could say was he could only check the records of who went into the room the next morning. We also realised to our horror that there were no security cameras in the hallways of the hotels. We insisted on having the police come to the hotel. The police, upon arriving, seemed really professional. However, there was nothing they could do. They told us to go back to the police station the next day with the hotel's report. The following morning, a report by the hotel showed - surprise surprise - that no one else but the hotel staff and us entered the room. And since the hotel had clearly implied that it couldn't be the fault of the hotel staff, we decided not to waste our holiday by bothering with a police report that definitely would not help us get our money back. Having travelled in so many different countries, and staying in so many hotels and hostels, there is none that is at bad as this. I am definitely never going to stay there and will make sure none of my friends stays there too!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley brilliant - cannot fault it!”
Reviews.Author: happystimpy
Reviews.Content: Went on a trip to Barcelona for my girlfriends birthday for 3 nights (saturday to tuesday) and went fot his hotel largely due to reviews on tripadvisor - wasn't disappointed at all. Arrived at the hotel at about 10 at night and was very happy with the room given which was comfortable and modern. The staff were very good and spoke very good english and helped us find everything we needed. The hotel is only a short walk from the main roads such as Las Ramblas and very convinient to get everywhere yet not so in the centre that it is busy - we found it perfect for getting about walking all the way down to the harbour and back on our first day. The metro is also available and not far from the hotel, it is very clean and practicle and probably the safest i have felt in late at night in any I have been on in Europre (which is quite a few!). During our stay we visited the majority of Gaudi's buildings and most of the main sites in central barcelona. We didn't use the restaurant itself but it and the bar looked nice. Nexr door is a restaurant called Balthazar which was brilliant food and very decently priced, there was a number of restaurants and bars around the local area within 5 minutes offering anything you could want from traditional spanish to chinese and italian. Having travelled quite a lot around Europe before and been to Barcelona before I can honestly say this is one of my favourite trips and the hotel was a key part of this - would definitely reccomend to all and would go back there myself if I returned to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: NOLALADY_UK
Reviews.Content: The location was pretty good. About 10 minute walk from Diagonal metro stop in the Eixample district. The lobby was a 3 star, but the rooms were about a 2 star in my opinion. The rooms were a bit weird as far as decor goes. Check out is at 12:00pm and around 12:05, I got a call from the front desk asking me if "I would like to stay another night". I said we are on our way down now and the guy said "Check out is at 12 lady!" Very rude and unneccesary. I would not return to this hotel or recommend it to anyone. There are so many nice hotels on the same street which I wish I would have seen on Expedia or Trip Advisor. I would have stayed elsewhere. Also, for a "4 star", there is no computer/internet to use. I was told I could use a cafe down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dh624
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona for 3 nights on vacation and this was the perfect hotel. Location is excellent - only 2 mins walk from the metro stop, and only 2 stops from most important sites. The local neighborhood is also a great place - lots of restaurants and shops to choose from and felt very safe. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and went above and beyond to help us. Would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing in comparison to the reviews I read here”
Reviews.Author: Xenia1977
Reviews.Content: Two main issues upset us the most, both happening at check-out: 1) No one would come to help us with luggage with the excuse that they don't offer such a service in the mornings; 2) The more serious thing, which we didn't have time to address thourougly because we were in a rush to the airport - we were presented with a minibar and telephone bill, each with five or six items on it. The fact was that we hadn't used either, so where did the bills come from? When I said that we hadn't used these services, the receptionist took away the bills immediately, without even inquiring if I was telling the truth. Was it something that they try to pull off with everyone, and then if it works - it works, and if not they just say "nevermind"? Or was it an honest mistake?! We were generally very disappointed by this hotel. First of all, it is a mistery how these people pulled off a 4 star rating. The appearance of the rooms and the general service is at a 3 star level. The rooms are gloomy, the noise from the street too audible. I was very satisfied with the cleanliness of the room and the bathroom was okay. The internet connection was free and excellent with an adsl cable. I also liked staying close to Gracia, but if you are more interested in the center of Barcelona, the hotel is a bit far and it will take you 20-25 minutes of fast walking to get to the main square.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and good location.”
Reviews.Author: lovemybeaches
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at this hotel. Location good, it was clean and the staff were really helpful. I wouldn't say it was a four star hotel, but if you want convenient location and good value for money then I would say this fits the bill. The area seems reasonably up market, we never felt ill at ease when walking out at night and there are plenty of shops, restaurants and bars all within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean, quite”
Reviews.Author: mel_salonika
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hotel 5 days. it was clean, the room was not very spacy but it was ok, the good thing was that it was really quite (even when there are many little kids creaming outside, you dont hear a thing). the breakfast was expensive in my opinion (15 euros/person!) and there wasnt any big variety. it was close to the city center, there were many nice places where one could eat breakfast without spending a ton of money, metro station nearby and a supermarket across the street

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: andyibz
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a around a 15/20 min walk to the Plaza Catalunya in the centre of Barcelona it costs around 5€ in a taxi. It was great value for money when we stayed, the room was fine even for three of us and we had everything we needed. Plus it was surprisingly quiet for a city centre hotel and we slep really well. The breakfast gave us a really good start to the day and the staff were pleasant and cordial. Nothing to do with the Hotel but we did get royally ripped off in the taxi back to airport, so be carefully! However all in all for a basic clean City Centre Hotel it fits the bill!

Reviews.Title: “Great position, affordable, neat”
Reviews.Author: kaskonjunf
Reviews.Content: Hotel has 4 stars, it is situated close to the city center and it is pretty affordable for almost anyone. I cannot comment food because we never ate there and I don`t know is there a parking because we used taxi all the time and according to our calculations, that`s the cheapest and best way of transport in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Sibarita2009
Reviews.Content: Have stayed twice (August and September 2009) and it really is a perfect place to stay when visiting this beautiful city. Attentive staff. Rooms are of an adequate size. TV's are a bit small but we didn't come to watch television. Mini bar if you need to use one and spacious ensuite. There is a very good supermarket across the road as well as a cafe for breakfast. There are two Metro stations nearby and Passeig de Gracia is literally a 5-10 minute walk for some serious retail therapy. There are also some good bars and restaurants a few minutes walk away down C. de Balmes.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TrumpeterScotland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. On arrival I was impressed by the lobby and reception area, which looked brand new. The staff on check-in were friendly, helpful and spoke fluent English. The room was larger than I'd expect, and the bed was firm, which I appreciated as it's good for my back and I slept well each night. The are surrounding the hotel has a decent seletion of cafes, bars and restaurants to choose from, and the city centre is around 15 minutes walk away (or 5 in a taxi which were everywhere and very reasonable. Breakfast hours are good, allowing a bit of a lie-in, and the variety and quality couldn't be faulted, however the only blip on the whole stay was the staff at breakfast, who were unhelpful to the point of almost being rude. That apart, an excellent hotel which I'd definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Telma29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of barcelona, near public transports. The rooms are nice, comfortable and clean! The carpets in the common areas were very dirty. Noise from the next-door room is very loud. Voices are clearly heard and it is rather disturbing during the night. Breakfast price too high (alternatives are available nearby), I suggest PAUL, a good place to have your breakfast for 3-4 euros!

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: suna13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 4-star, which it didn't even come close to! The main problem was that it is filthy dirty. The rooms were okay but the hallways were dirtier than any I've ever seen in a hotel. Desk clerks were helpful and pleasant, but bar/restaurant employees were not. Location of the hotel is good, with plenty of restaurants nearby. Would not recommend this place to anyone, however.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: Zizgig
Reviews.Content: Good value. Location is perfect to visit Barcelona. Can be a bit noisy at night (or early in the morning :-).

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jesmin1
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with large rooms and great bathroom/shower. we got a quiet room at the back. it is not in the downtown area, but underground stations are close by. it is easy walking distance to the gaudi house, where you can pick up the red or blue routes of the tourist bus. note that the last bus is at 8pm, so you may need to return to the hotel by underground (buy the T-10 ticket for 10 rides). the "Nostrum" store near the Provenca metro stop is great for a quick home-cooked style take-out meal. tel:[----] www.nostrum.cat (ask the lady to microwave your food to eat in the hotel). it's just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: linda2602
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and our flights through Easyjet and got a better rate for B&B than booking flight and hotel separately. The hotel was better than we expected for the price. It was clean, modern and the staff were welcoming and helpful. Breakfasts were very good. It is located a little away from the bustle of the main tourist areas, but was only a 5 minute walk to a metro station (Diagonal) and a pleasant 20 minute stroll to Placa Catalunya. This hotel is ideal for those who want a smart hotel away from the crowds but within easy reach of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good but never a 4 star, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: london_traveller9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for 3 nights from 31st Dec 07 to celebrate new years. I'm a regular traveller and often look for a clean and comfortable hotel. Evenia Rosello is located in the quiet suburns of the city with approximately a 15 minute walk from the centre. A convenience store is directly outside, with few restaurants, pubs and bars on your doorstep. Metro is also nearby. The hotel itself is quite compact, rooms are clean and comfortable, cleaned daily. Television is a minuture 15inch LCD which isn't great considering it is so far away from any seating area, plus reception is poor and no English channels! The major downside of this hotel was that some of the staff were VERY reluctant to go out of their way to assist you. Room service stops at 10pm and considering we went there to celebrate the new year we it was a shock to be told that we couldn't have any ice or even an iron after this time. The ice machine was turned on at the bar and the staff rudely refused to serve me as the time had gone just after 10pm. Clearly this is not the level of service expected from a 4 star, based on the size and facilities on offer it is at best a good quality 3 star, with extremely unhelpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: DBSF
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely a bit nicer than I had expected. It was very well-maintained, and had a very professional and helpful staff. The breakfast that was included was more than I expected to get. The location was perfect. It was away from the hustle and bustle of Ramblas and other tourist attractions, set in a nicer (and seemingly safer) neighborhood than others. That being said, all of the places we wanted to see were easily walkable, and for those further away, the Metro was just a couple of blocks away. A bunch of cute little restaurants and bars were very close by as well. My only complaint was about the beds---very hard and uncomfortable, but I think my brain was so confused about what time it was that even a comfortable bed wouldn't have helped. Overall, this hotel is a hidden gem, and is highly recommended by me. Sorry, can't comment on value, since we booked our trip as a package deal for Barcelona and Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: pinter11
Reviews.Content: Negative points: - No soundproofing between rooms, the noise from the corridors and adjoining rooms was unbelievable. you could hear the TV next door, the room above us walking around and the person beside us snoring. The noise from the street is also bad as you have a couple of bars and night clubs on the street - Staff very rude, especially the bar staff. If you are looking for a hotel to help you with your stay this is not the one for you. - Halls were dirty, the carpet in the halls was like something straight out of a building site. - Heating, the temp. controllers in the rooms didn't work so we ended up sleeping with the window open. Positives, - Location is ok. The area around is nice and the metro is 2 blocks away. The walk to the city center is about 7 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travel79
Reviews.Content: This is a new and modern hotel with a good location and all commodities. Barcelona is a huge city, you must choose if you want to stay near the beach or near city center, if you want city center, this is a good spot. I must say i made a reservation for a 3 star hotel, AB VILLADOMAT, but this hotel had some kind of problem and called a taxi that took us to the neighbour Cotursa Rossello (4 stars), no extra cost. Both hotels are modern and new, with good location. Cotursa Rossello is in a neighbourhood called Eixample, i think its a great place to stay, you can go walking everywhere, you're close to the center but its also a quiet place at night, unlike Ramblas area or Born. Well, this hotel as i said before is new, bedroom was a bit small but had all you need, a good bathroom and breakfast was delicious, with good variety and quality. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, i liked it very much. I would recommend it to a friend, as well as Villa Domat, wich may be less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the gym?”
Reviews.Author: Marc_IT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in July and again one night in August. It was a business trip, both times and the hotel was booked by the local office staff. It is used regularly by the company and everyone has been pleased with the hotel. The bar is a typical hotel bar, lacks atmosphere but there are bars very close by, also the restaurant is never too busy but I chose to eat in restaurants either side of the hotel and both are good. The hotel bar does very generous measures so drink with caution! My only disappointment was with the fitness room. It was difficult to find, had to negotiate darkness until finally finding a light switch. Very basic exercise bikes and a solitary treadmill. No resistance machines and no water supplied. Other than that all is good, rooms nicely appointed, bathrooms are good and everything is clean. Breakfast is a buffet with a really good choice of fresh produce. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good contemporary 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: gpg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on 20th July 2006. Good location - less than 5 mintues walk to Provenca/Diagonal underground stations. Just turn left out of the hotel and walk two blocks. Or 10 minutes walk to Gaudi's Pedrera and the Tourist Information office in Palace Robert at Diagonal. The hotel is brand new, modern, contemporary and very clean - that is, apart from the corridors upstairs. Who knows why they are not vacumed properly - not a big issue - but strangely noticeable in new hotel. Ask for a room at the back - its very quiet overlooking the restaurant terrace and childrens playground. We had to take a smoking room but there was no smell at all. We paid 70 euros plus tax per night through a discount hotel website. For this price, they give you one of the handful of less spacious double rooms on each floor - but still with excellent king size bed. These rooms are really set up for single business people on overnight stays but a couple will be very comfortable for a few days. The lunch time set menu in the restaurant is very popular with local office workers - its only 10 euros for three courses - but only on Monday to Friday. The same menu is also available in the evening but the price increases to 18 euros. At the weekend the set menu increases to 20 euros at lunch or dinner. The plasma TV only has two English channels - CNN International and BBC World. But, BBC World was not available. There is Wi-Fi but no internet terminal in the hotel - a big negative. The reception desk will direct you to a copy shop about 10 minutes walk away on Diagonal. However, there is a very inexpensive internet cafe in the next street - 60 cents for 30 minutes. Turn right out of the hotel - turn left at the next junction - the cafe is half way down on the right. There is a large supermarket - Bon Preu - behind a small door over the road from the hotel entrance. Lots of deli stuff to take home or eat in your room. There is a great local brasserie very close to the hotel - excellent set 3-course menu in the evening for 8.5 euros including bread, wine and water - La Tasqueta de Muntaner. It says "Braserie" above the door. Turn right out of the hotel, turn left at the next junction, the restaurant is immediately on the other side of the road. There are bar tables in the main room and restaurant tables in the back "salon" plus a couple of tables outside. A very pleasant place. Overall, a good hotel in a good locality, an excellent value four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ehzoyzdcr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cotursa Rossello with our 7 year old daugter for a 3 night break in April. Our room was on the 2nd floor at the front and the traffic was quite noisy but then we expect that in a bustling town centre and we actually slept very well. There was nothing especially positve or negative about the room but the bathroom was nicely designed and very modern. The staff were friendly. The location is very pleasant, away from the main tourist area and in an upmarket area full of independent shops boutiques and restaurants. Having said that, most of the tourist attactions are quite a walk away and perhaps that is why we slept soundly! But taxis are cheap so you don't have to walk and the tube station is nearby. We highly recommend a nearby cafe for breakfast called Paul. We didn't try the hotel breakfast although it looked good. There is a children's playground directly behind the hotel so this may be a good option if you have young children. Our big surprise was the hotel restaurant. It looks quite uninviting - first it is empty, the menu is not displayed and they don't dim the lights - but we ate there on the last night when our daughter was too tired to go out walking again and were pleasantly surprised at the good quality of the food and it was also incredibly cheap compared to the other meals we had eaten. The service was also exceptional (just as well as we were the only ones there!) They were also happy to prepare a dish for our daughter who does not eat meat which was not on the menu. It is a shame they do not do something more about the ambience to attract some customers. We do not know what we paid for the hotel as we got a last minute package of £215 each for scheduled Iberia flights from Heathrow (at very good times) and 3 nights in the hotel but this seemed like a very good value hotel for that price. We recommend getting a taxi from the airport as it is only 20 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maverick911
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a 3 night long weekend break in March. We were allocated a room on the 5th Floor (513) we found the room to be clean and functional. The maid was excellant and full of smiles. The aircon unit was not very good, believe it or not the max temp reached 26 c outside, we had to open the window to stay at a reasonable temp. The room faced onto the main street but with the window closed noise was minimal. The room had a laminated floor and as a result we could hear other guests walking around and furniture being moved. Of the two lifts only one was in use during our stay. The reception staff were attentive and arranged for early morning calls and taxi's. The restaurant staff were hard work smiles at a premium but the food (mainly breakfast) was very good. Overall a good city centre hotel but the internal noise needs to be sorted out.

HotelInfo.Name: Evenia Rosello
HotelInfo.Address: Rossello 191, 08036 Barcelona, Spain (Formerly Cotursa Rosello)
